org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.dispatch

Class AbstractDispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.dispatch.AbstractDispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable<ConfigurationType>, DispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>, WorkflowItem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractErrorHandlerLayer, DispatchStackImpl.TopLayer, ErrorBounce, IntermediateProvenance, Invoke, Loop, Parallelize, Stop

    public abstract class AbstractDispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>
extends Object
implements DispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>
    Convenience abstract implementation of DispatchLayer
    Author:
    Tom Oinn

      Set the parent dispatch stack of this layer, this is called when a layer is added to the dispatch stack and can be safely ignored by end users of this API

      • receiveResultCompletion

        public void receiveResultCompletion(DispatchCompletionEvent completionEvent)
        Description copied from interface: DispatchLayer
        Receive a (possibly partial) completion event from the layer below. This is only going to be used when the activities invocation is capable of streaming partial data back up through the dispatch stack before the activities has completed. Not all dispatch stack layers are compatible with this mode of operation, for example retry and recursion do not play well here!
        Specified by:
        receiveResultCompletion in interface DispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>

      • finishedWith

        public void finishedWith(String owningProcess)
        Description copied from interface: DispatchLayer
        Called when there will be no more events with the specified process identifier, can be used to purge cached state from layers within the stack
        Specified by:
        finishedWith in interface DispatchLayer<ConfigurationType>
